posts.name: Arnaud's
posts.note: Tin-ceilinged 'grande dame' of Creole dining since 1918, featuring seafood classics and a jazz brunch. For dinner, I ordered the 'Alligator Sausage' appetizer, and for my main meal, I ordered the 'Crawfish O’Connor' which is baked in a Brandy-infused classic Creole tomato based sauce and served with Jasmine rice.

posts.name: Bon Ton Café
posts.note: Nostalgic, brick-walled spot serving classic Cajun dishes since 1953, except on weekends. For an appetizer I had the turtle soup and was great but salter than I thought it would be because the salt cuts down on the gameiness is what I read later. For my dinner I had the 'Red Fish Bon Ton' which is red fish with crab on top.

posts.name: Cafe Du Monde
posts.note: Iconic New Orleans cafe known for café au laits, chicory coffee and beignets since 1862. Like everyone else I order a larger order of beignets with a hot chocolate because it was cold day.

posts.name: Kermit's Treme Mother in Law Lounge
posts.note: Kermit's Treme Mother in Law Lounge has a catchy, warm environment. When you walk in you will always be greeted with a warm meal and a cold drink. Kermit's Treme Mother in Law Lounge has been host to many musicians from all over the world and we will continue to do so as the word spreads of the awesome environment of Kermit's Treme Mother in Law Lounge. Come in and enjoy our cozy backyard with some of the best tasting BBQ or deep fried catfish in the city of Kenner, LA.

posts.name: Parkway Bakery and Tavern
posts.note: Longtime (since 1911) neighborhood hangout with a patio known for classic-style po' boys. You have to get yourself one of their 'Shrimp Po Boy' with lettece, tomato, and special sauce. NOTE - Watch map link seems to point to Hungarian Google maps.
posts.cptn: Shrimp Po Boy with lettece, tomatoe, and special sauce from Parkway Bakery and Tavern in New Orleans, LA

posts.name: Port of Call
posts.note: Hefty burgers, loaded baked potatoes, cocktails and a jukebox draw lines at this 50-year-old dive. The thing my friend that sugested Port of Call told me to order was one of their burgers which is what they are known for.

posts.name: Walker's BBQ
posts.note: Cash-only counter-serve smokehouse serves famed po' boys plus BBQ standards till they run out.
